metadata.name: HackTool - Stracciatella Execution
metadata.comment: Detects Stracciatella which executes a Powershell runspace from within C# (aka SharpPick technique) with AMSI, ETW and Script Block Logging disabled based on PE metadata characteristics.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\stracciatella.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('stracciatella.exe') AND lower(device.desc) = lower('stracciatella') AND (contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('sha256=9d25e61ec1527e2a69d7c2a4e3fe2fe15890710c198a66a9f25d99fdf6c7b956')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('sha256=fd16609bd9830c63b9413671678bb159b89c357d21942ddbb6b93add808d121a'))))

output.summary: Detects Stracciatella which executes a Powershell runspace from within C# (aka SharpPick technique) with AMSI, ETW and Script Block Logging disabled based on PE metadata characteristics.
